meanings.definition: To dislike or hate very much.
meanings.sent1: I abore the taste of broccoli.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to abore the new brand of food.
meanings.sent4: His face abored any form of exercise.
meanings.sent5: The child abored the idea of going to bed early.

meanings.definition: A feeling of strong dislike or hatred.
meanings.sent1: Her abore for spiders made her scream.
meanings.sent2: The abore in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent3: The abore towards Mondays was shared by many.
meanings.sent4: The abore in his eyes was unmistakable.
meanings.sent5: The abore in her heart grew stronger each day.

meanings.definition: To feel strong dislike or hatred for.
meanings.sent1: He abores the thought of public speaking.
meanings.sent2: They abore the idea of cruelty to animals.
meanings.sent3: The toddler seemed to abore the taste of vegetables.
meanings.sent4: She abores the sound of nails on a chalkboard.
meanings.sent5: The old man abores the cold weather.
